1_TextBox_1: Click on Add Data in the Welcome to 	Slicer module
2_TextBox_0: Slicer loads the prostate MRI dataset
3_ArrowText_0:
Click on Welcome to Slicer in the
Modules' menu and browse to
the category Segmentation.
4_ArrowText_0:
Enter the model's name Prostate in
the Segmentation model menu
5_ArrowText_0: Enter the Input T2 volume msdprostate-01-adc
6_ArrowText_0: And the Input ADC volume msd-prostate-01-adc
6_TextBox_1:
Click on Create new segmentation on
Apply
8_TextBox_0: Slicer shows the result of the AI-based prostate segmentation
10_ArrowText_0:
Select the module MONAIAuto3DSeg and enter the
model's name Brain Tumor Segmentation in the
Segmentation model menu
10_TextBox_1:
Select the model Brain Tumor Segmentation
(BRATS) GLI
11_TextBox_0:
Enter the input volumes as follows:
Input T2F volume: BraTS-GLI_00005-000-t12f
Input T1C volume: BraTS-GLI_00005-000-t1c
Input T1N volume: BraTS-GLI_00005-000-t1n
Input T2W volume: BraTS-GLI_00005-000-t2w
Click on Create new Segmentation on Apply
Click on Apply to start the segmentation
12_TextBox_0: Slicer starts running the inference task
13_ArrowText_1:
Once the segmentation is done, 'Processing finished'
appears in the Slicer GUI
14_TextBox_0:
In the Add DICOM Data module,
select the Patient patient1 and
double click on the image
CT_Thorax_Abdomen to load it in
Slicer
15_ArrowText_0:
Select the module MONAIAuto3DSeg and enter the
model's name Whole Body Segmentation in the
Segmentation model menu
15_ArrowText_1:
Select the model Whole Body Segmentation
TS1 - quick
16_TextBox_0:
Select the input Volume 6: CT_Thorax_Abdomen,
Click on Create new Segmentation on Apply
Click on Apply to start the segmentation
18_TextBox_0:
Slicer displays the result of the AI-based segmentation
using the Whole Body Segmentation TS1- quick
